elements.name: CAD
elements.title: CAD
elements.html: Coronary artery disease - a problem with the blood supply to the heart, e.g. due to narrowing, furring, or blockage of the arteries or blood vessels supplying the heart - can cause cardiomyopathy. Please select the following that apply to you:

elements.name: CAD.NARROWING
elements.title: You have narrowed or blocked arteries or blood vessels around your heart

elements.name: CAD.IHD
elements.title: You have ischaemic heart disease

elements.name: CAD.ICM
elements.title: Your cardiomyopathy is due to a problem with the blood supply to the heart (ischaemia or ischaemic heart disease)

elements.name: CAD.NORMAL
elements.title: The blood supply to your heart is normal

elements.name: CAD.PCA
elements.title: Had a heart bypass graft (CABG)

elements.name: CAD.STENT
elements.title: Had an angiogram and procedure to open a blocked artery or blood vessel to the heart (PCI or PCA)

elements.name: CAD.THROMBOLYSIS
elements.title: Had thrombolysis (clot-busting injection) for a heart attack

elements.name: CAD.NORMALANGIO
elements.title: An angiogram that showed the blood supply to your heart was normal?

elements.name: CAD.OTHEREXCLUDE
elements.title: Any other tests that showed you do not have any narrowing or blockage of arteries or blood vessels around your heart

elements.name: CAD.OTHEREXCLUDE.TEXT
elements.title: Please provide details

elements.name: VALVE_explainer
elements.title: VALVE
elements.html: Heart valve problems (narrowed or leaky valves) can cause cardiomyopathy. Sometimes cardiomyopathy can lead to heart valve problems. If you have a heart valve problem, it is helpful to know if it started before or after your cardiomyopathy.

elements.name: VALVE
elements.title: Have you ever had any kind of heart valve problem, now or in the past?

elements.name: VALVE_PRIOR
elements.title: Have you ever had any kind of heart valve problem before your cardiomyopathy, or been told that your valve problem caused your cardiomyopathy?

elements.name: VALVE_TYPE_EXPLAINER
elements.title: ValveType
elements.html:
There are four chambers in your heart and the valves make sure that the blood flows through them in one direction.

If the valve does not close properly, it will allow blood to leak backwards. This is called valve incompetence, or regurgitation, or a leaky valve.

If your valve does not open fully, it will obstruct the flow of blood. This is called valve stenosis or narrowing.

elements.name: VALVE_AORTIC
elements.title: VALVE_AORTIC	Your Aortic valve opens to allow blood to flow from your heart to your aorta, the main blood vessel supplying your body.  Please select the option that best describes your aortic valve:

elements.name: VALVE_MITRAL
elements.title: Your Mitral valve opens to allow blood to flow between the chambers (left atrium and left ventricle) of your heart.  Please select the option that best describes your mitral valve:

elements.name: VALVE_PULMONARY
elements.title: our Pulmonary valve opens to allow blood to flow from your heart to your lungs.  Please select the option that best describes your pulmonary valve:

elements.name: VALVE_AR_GRADE
elements.title: Valve problems can be very variable.   It is helpful to know how leaky your aortic valve is (or if it has been treated how leaky it was).

elements.name: VALVE_AS_GRADE
elements.title: Valve problems can be very variable.   Valve problems can be very variable.   It is helpful to know how narrowed your aortic valve is (or if it has been treated how narrowed it was).

elements.name: VALVE_MR_GRADE
elements.title: Valve problems can be very variable.   It is helpful to know how leaky your mitral valve is (or if it has been treated how leaky it was).

elements.name: VALVE_MS_GRADE
elements.title: Valve problems can be very variable.   It is helpful to know how narrowed your mitral valve is (or if it has been treated how narrowed it was). Which of the following best matches the description of your mitral valve problem?

elements.name: VALVE_PR_GRADE
elements.title: Valve problems can be very variable.   It is helpful to know how leaky your pulmonary valve is (or if it has been treated how leaky it was).

elements.name: VALVE_PS_GRADE
elements.title: Valve problems can be very variable. It is helpful to know how narrowed your pulmonary  valve is (or if it has been treated how narrowed it was). Which of the following best matches the description of your mitral valve problem?

elements.name: CHD_explainer
elements.title: CHD_text
elements.html: Congenital heart disease (for example a hole in the heart) changes the way blood flows through the heart. This can change the shape and function of the chambers of the heart leading to cardiomyopathy

elements.name: CHD
elements.title: Have you been diagnosed with congenital heart disease, or did you need surgery on your heart as a child?

elements.name: CHD_TEXT
elements.title: If yes, please provide details

elements.name: HTN
elements.title: Have you been diagnosed with high blood pressure?

elements.name: HTN_ORDER
elements.title: Which was diagnosed first, your cardiomyopathy or your high blood pressure?

elements.name: CHOL
elements.title: Have you been diagnosed with high cholesterol?

choices.text: I have never had high cholesterol
I used to have high cholesterol, but it is well controlled now

elements.name: DIABETES
elements.title: Have you been diagnosed with diabetes?

elements.name: DIABETES_AGE
elements.title: How old were you when your diabetes was diagnosed?

elements.name: DIABETES_MONOGENIC
elements.title: Have you been diagnosed with an inherited or genetic form of diabetes?

elements.name: DIABETES_TREATMENT
elements.title: How is your diabetes treated? Please check all that apply

elements.name: DIABETES_INSULIN_START
elements.title: How soon after your diabetes diagnosis did you start using insulin on a regular basis?  Please select one answer that best describes your treatment

choices.text: Immediately, and I continue to use insulin
Immediately, but only for a few days or weeks until my sugars were controlled and then I stopped.
I have only been given insulin in an emergency

elements.otherErrorText: A description is required for choices of "other".

elements.name: RENAL
elements.title: Do you have kidney disease or kidney failure (renal failure)?

elements.name: CANCER
elements.title: Have you ever had cancer?

elements.name: CANCER_SEQUENCE
elements.title: Which was diagnosed first, your cardiomyopathy or your cancer?

elements.name: CANCER_TYPE
elements.title: What type of cancer did you have? Please check all that apply.
elements.otherErrorText: A description is required for choices of "other".

elements.name: CANCER_CHEMO
elements.title: Did you have chemotherapy?

elements.name: CANCER_CHEMO_TEXT
elements.title: If yes, please enter the name of each chemotherapy you received:

elements.name: CANCER_RADIOTHERAPY_CHEST
elements.title: Did you have radiotherapy to your chest?

elements.name: CANCER_RADIOTHERAPY_HEART
elements.title: Was your heart included in the radiation field or were you told the radiotherapy could affect your heart?

elements.name: PREGNANT
elements.title: Have you ever been pregnant?

elements.name: OFFSPRING
elements.title: How many children have you had?

elements.name: PERIPARTUM
elements.title: Was your cardiomyopathy diagnosed?

choices.text: While pregnant, in the last month before delivering a baby
While pregnant, but not in the last month
In the first 5 months after delivering a baby

elements.name: PREECLAMPSIA
elements.title: Have you had preeclampsia?

elements.name: PREECLAMPSIA_AGE
elements.title: If you had preeclampsia how old were you the first time?

elements.name: EDUCATION
elements.title: What is the highest level of education that you have completed?

elements.name: MARITALSTATUS
elements.title: What is your marital status?

elements.name: ETHNICITY
elements.title: Which of the following best describes your ethnicity?
elements.otherErrorText: A description is required for choices of "other".

elements.name: SMOKING
elements.title: Smoking damages blood vessels and is a known risk factor for several forms of heart disease. Please select the smoking status that best describes you:

elements.name: SMOKING_YEARS
elements.title: How many years have you smoked?

elements.name: SMOKING_CIGS
elements.title: How many cigarettes do you smoke per day?

elements.name: ETOH
elements.title: Have you ever or do you currently drink alcohol?

choices.text: Yes, but only in the past

elements.name: AGE_ONSET
elements.title: How old were you when your cardiomyopathy was diagnosed?

elements.name: CARDIOLOGIST
elements.title: Please enter the name of your cardiologist:

elements.name: HOSPITAL
elements.title: Please enter the name of the hospital:

elements.name: CMR
elements.title: Have you had a cardiac MRI (CMR) scan?

elements.name: CMR_SITE
elements.title: Please enter the name of the hospital where you had your scan:

elements.name: CMR_REPORT
elements.title: Do you have a copy of your cardiac MRI (CMR) scan report?

elements.name: ECG
elements.title: Do you have a copy of your ECG?

elements.name: GENETIC_TESTED
elements.title: Have you had genetic testing for cardiomyopathy?

elements.name: GENETIC_TESTED_SITE
elements.title: Which hospital did you have your genetic test at?

elements.name: GENETIC_TESTED_RESULT
elements.title: What was the result of your genetic test?

choices.text: A genetic variant of uncertain significance - might be the cause of my cardiomyopathy, but further testing needed

elements.otherErrorText: A description is required for choices of "other".

elements.name: GENE_NAME_DIAGNOSTIC
elements.title: Please enter the name of the gene identified as the cause of your cardiomyopathy.

elements.name: GENETIC_TESTED_REPORT_AVAIL
elements.title: Do you have a copy of your genetic test result?

elements.name: EVENTS_STROKE
elements.title: Have you ever had a stroke or mini-stroke?

choices.text: Yes, at the time my cardiomyopathy was diagnosed

elements.name: EVENTS_AF
elements.title: Have you ever had atrial fibrillation?

choices.text: Yes, at the time my cardiomyopathy was diagnosed

elements.name: EVENTS_PPM
elements.title: Have you had a pacemaker?

choices.text: Yes, at the time my cardiomyopathy was diagnosed

elements.name: EVENTS_ICD
elements.title: Do you have an ICD?
elements.description: Implantable cardioverter-defibrillator insertion - small device which can treat people with dangerously abnormal heart rhythms. Some ICDs also act as pacemakers, if yours does tick 'pacemaker' above too.

choices.text: Yes, at the time my cardiomyopathy was diagnosed

elements.name: ICD_PRIMARY_PREV
elements.title: Was your ICD implanted because you had had a life-threatening heart rhythm problem or a cardiac arrest?

elements.name: ICD_SHOCK
elements.title: Since you have had your ICD has it ever given you a shock because of a serious heart rhythm problem or cardiac arrest?

elements.name: ICD_INAPPROPRIATE
elements.title: Since you have had your ICD has it ever given you an ‘inappropriate shock’?

elements.name: EVENTS_CRT
elements.title: Do you have CRT?
elements.description:
CRT – cardiac resynchronisation therapy (biventricular pacing) – this is a special type of pacemaker that helps the left and right side of the heart beat in time with each other.  It has 3 leads.
This device often has a defibrillator – if yours does tick ‘ICD’ above too.

choices.text: Yes, at the time my cardiomyopathy was diagnosed

elements.name: EVENTS_ARREST
elements.title: Have you ever had a cardiac arrest?
elements.description: When your heart suddenly stops pumping blood around your body, usually because of a problem with electrical signals in your heart.

choices.text: Yes, at the time my cardiomyopathy was diagnosed

elements.name: EVENTS_LVAD
elements.title: Have you ever had an LVAD implanted?
elements.description: Left ventricular assist device LVAD – is a kind of artificial heart pump. It is used to treat people with severe heart failure and is sometimes given to people on the waiting list for a heart transplant.

elements.name: EVENTS_TX_LIST
elements.title: Have you ever been entered on the heart transplant list?

elements.name: EVENTS_TRANSPLANT
elements.title: Have you had a heart transplant?

elements.name: LVOT_OBSTRUCT
elements.title: Have you been diagnosed with left ventricular outflow obstruction?
elements.description: Sometimes, if the septum of your heart is very thickened, it can get in the way of blood flowing out of the heart.  This is called left ventricular outflow obstruction.

elements.name: SEPTAL_REDUCTION
elements.title: Have you had treatment to reduce the size of your septum (septal reduction), including surgery or ablation?
elements.description: If the septum is very thick it can be treated to reduce its size:  Treatments include surgery to remove some of the septum (myomectomy) or injecting alcohol to disrupt the blood supply to the septum and shrink it (alcohol septal ablation)

elements.name: MEDICATION
elements.title: Please enter the medication you take for your cardiomyopathy

elements.name: RESEARCH
elements.title: Have you ever taken part in other medical or health research?

elements.name: RESEARCH_TEXT
elements.title: If yes please give the name of each study:
